docs.lead_paragraph: Uncapped Benfica goalkeeper Ederson has been called into the Brazilian squad for World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Paraguay later this month, national coach Tite said on Friday.

headline.main: Brazil's Tite Calls Up Uncapped Benfica Keeper Ederson
headline.print_headline: Brazil's Tite Calls Up Uncapped Benfica Keeper Ederson

docs.snippet: Uncapped Benfica goalkeeper Ederson has been called into the Brazilian squad for World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Paraguay later this month, national coach Tite said on Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: An Ethiopian opposition leader from a region hit by deadly anti-government protests last year pleaded not guilty in court on Friday, after prosecutors brought charges against him for inciting unrest.

headline.main: Ethiopian Opposition Leader Pleads Not Guilty to Incitement Charges
headline.print_headline: Ethiopian Opposition Leader Pleads Not Guilty to Incitement Charges

docs.snippet: An Ethiopian opposition leader from a region hit by deadly anti-government protests last year pleaded not guilty in court on Friday, after prosecutors brought charges against him for inciting unrest....

docs.lead_paragraph: German authorities say they expect to have a cannabis-growing program up and running in 2019 after the country approved legislation allowing some patients to get the drug as a prescription medication.

headline.main: Germany Expects Cannabis-Growing Program to Be Going in 2019
headline.print_headline: Germany Expects Cannabis-Growing Program to Be Going in 2019

docs.snippet: German authorities say they expect to have a cannabis-growing program up and running in 2019 after the country approved legislation allowing some patients to get the drug as a prescription medication....

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. and tribal officials are opposing an effort by the developer of the $3.8 billion Dakota Access oil pipeline to keep some information shielded from the public amid a court battle over the project.

docs.lead_paragraph: The family of a Liberian Ebola nurse named Time magazine's "Person of the Year" in 2014 wants to sue a hospital whose staff they say were too scared to treat her when she died of complications around childbirth.

docs.lead_paragraph: If Connecticut and Stanford meet in the N.C.A.A. tournament, the game could come down to a UConn star’s scoring and her sister’s defensive tenacity.

headline.main: UConn-Stanford? It Would Have Nothing on This Sibling Rivalry

docs.lead_paragraph: A second man was arrested Friday in connection with the slaying of Georgia high school teacher who vanished nearly 12 years ago, with warrants saying the new suspect helped the woman's killer dispose of her body.

headline.main: 2nd Suspect Arrested in Case of Missing Georgia Teacher
headline.print_headline: 2nd Suspect Arrested in Case of Missing Georgia Teacher

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Olympic sprinter Frankie Fredericks has turned himself over to the IOC ethics commission following a French newspaper report linking him to a payment from a man who has been banned for life from track and field for corruption.

headline.main: Fredericks Turns Himself Over to IOC Ethics Commission
headline.print_headline: Fredericks Turns Himself Over to IOC Ethics Commission

docs.lead_paragraph: After the frenzy of the transfer window saw big-name foreign stars land mega-money deals, the Chinese Super League kicked off its new season in an empty stadium as newly-promoted Guizhou Zhicheng were held to a 1-1 draw by 10-man Liaoning Whowin.

headline.main: Points Shared as CSL Makes Anticlimactic Start in Empty Stadium
headline.print_headline: Points Shared as CSL Makes Anticlimactic Start in Empty Stadium
